alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 3:20PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...The Yampa River in Dinosaur National Monument. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas is likely. Some roadways and low-water crossings may be inundated with water and become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 318 PM MDT, the combination of warm, spring temperatures and the potential for periods of rain falling on upstream snowpack will lead to an increase in runoff due to snowmelt. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and are expected to reach critical levels Saturday morning. - This includes the following streams and drainages... The Yampa River from the confluences with Little Snake River, down to the confluence with the Green River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Moffat County, including Dinosaur National Monument. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
